intro: Hapalochilus stellula, commonly known as the star-flowered daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is found in coastal and inland regions. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a compact growth habit. Hapalochilus stellula is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
